com.direwolfdigital.cake.rules.abilities: This attack does 30 more damage for each {C} in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Discard any number of Exeggcute from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.
You may discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.
This attack does 20 more damage for each type of basic Energy card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.
Search your deck for up to 2 {L} Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
This Pokémon does 60 damage to itself.
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Move any number of {L} Energy from your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each Energy card you moved in this way.
This attack does 50 more damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.
This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon in play that has Alolan in its name.
Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Search your deck for up to 7 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Discard all {L} Energy from this Pokémon.
Put all Electropower cards from your discard pile into your hand.
Move 2 {W} Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You can use this attack only if this Pokémon has any damage counters on it. Both Active Pokémon are Knocked Out.
This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.
If this Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does 90 more damage.
This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.
Search your deck for up to 2 Electropower cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

Heal all damage from this Pokémon. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra {G} Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), shuffle all cards from your discard pile into your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.
Discard all {R} Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 60 more damage.
During your opponent's next turn, their Pokémon can't attack. (This includes Pokémon that come into play on that turn.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This attack does 30 damage for each Pokémon Tool card attached to all Pokémon.
Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.
Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.
Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 120 more damage.
If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), draw cards until you have 10 cards in your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.
Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent’s Active Pokémon. If you discarded a Pokémon Tool card in this way, this attack does 70 more damage.
Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.
During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

This attack does 20 damage times the amount of {M} Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. You can't do more than 100 damage to a Benched Pokémon in this way. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Discard all {L} Energy from this Pokémon.
Put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

Your opponent can't play any cards from their hand during their next turn. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra {P} Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), each player draws cards until they have 7 cards in their hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 50 damage for each Trainer card you find there.
Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

If any of your opponent's Pokémon have any {W} Energy attached to them, you may do 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon instead of their Active Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Reveal the top 7 cards of your deck. This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of {W} Energy you find there. Then, shuffle those Energy cards back into your deck and discard the other cards.
Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched {L} Pokémon.
You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

You can use this attack only if your Hitmonchan used Hit and Run during your last turn. This attack does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
This Pokémon can't use Dark Strike during your next turn.

Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX 6 times. (You can choose the same Pokémon more than once.) For each time you chose a Pokémon, do 30 damage to it. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
This attack does 50 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
For each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.
During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.
Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
This attack does 30 damage for each Energy card in your opponent's discard pile. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Flip a coin. If heads, put a card that evolves from this Pokémon from your discard pile onto this Pokémon to evolve it.
This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.
Discard an Item card from your hand. If you do, this attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Discard all {L} Energy from this Pokémon.
Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.
If your opponent's Pokémon used an attack that isn't a GX attack during their last turn, use it as this attack.
Discard all {R} Energy from this Pokémon. Then, discard a card from the top of your opponent's deck for each Energy you discarded in this way.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
For each card in your opponent's hand, put 1 damage counter on their Active Pokémon.
Heal all damage from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

This attack does 50 more damage for each Evolution Pokémon on your Bench.

Shuffle 5 {P} Pokémon from your discard pile into your deck.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Your opponent discards 2 cards from their hand.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
If your opponent has 4 or more cards in their hand, they reveal their hand. Discard cards you find there until your opponent has exactly 4 cards in their hand.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.
Your opponent puts their Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their hand.
Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.
Search your deck for up to 3 {L} Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.
Search your deck for up to 2 {D} Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 80 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from their hand during their next turn.
If your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

If you have used your GX attack, this attack does 70 more damage.

Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.
Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Look at the top 6 cards of your deck, reveal any number of Pokémon you find there, and put them into your hand. Discard the other cards.
If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 70 more damage. This attack’s damage isn't affected by Weakness.

This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile. You can't do more than 200 damage in this way.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 6 cards of your opponent’s deck and discard any number of Item cards you find there. Your opponent shuffles the other cards back into their deck.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.
As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Benched {W} Pokémon.
As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon and attach a {L} Energy card from your discard pile to each of them. If you do, discard all cards from this Pokémon and put it in the Lost Zone.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, its Retreat Cost is {C} more.
Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may move any number of {L} Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.
If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
If you have a Stadium card in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.
As long as you have fewer Pokémon in play than your opponent, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.
As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from their hand.
If this Pokémon has any {G} Energy attached to it, it takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's {R} Pokémon.
Each of your {M} Pokémon's Resistance is now -40.
Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX.
Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by your opponent's attacks if that damage is exactly 10, 30, 50, 70, 90, 110, 130, 150, 170, 190, 210, 230, or 250.
Each of your Pokémon that has any {M} Energy attached to it can't be affected by any Special Conditions. Remove any Special Conditions affecting those Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 2 {R} Energy cards from your hand. If you do, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon that has the Nuzzle attack, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Confused Pokémon between turns.
The Special Condition Poisoned is not removed when your opponent's Pokémon evolve or devolve.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach any number of {W} Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon that isn’t a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 2 damage counters on this Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for up to 2 {R} Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
This Pokémon takes 40 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 3 damage counters on this Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for up to 3 {D} Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
Your opponent’s Pokémon that have any damage counters on them, and any cards attached to those Pokémon, can’t be put into your opponent’s hand.

Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck, reveal a Trainer card you find there, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle the other cards back into your deck, and this Pokémon is now Asleep.
When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Whenever your opponent plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.
Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal up to 2 Trainer cards you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

When a {D} Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) that has any {D} Energy attached to it is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, that player takes 1 fewer Prize card.\n\nWhenever any player plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Stadium card.
Shuffle 6 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to has a Retreat Cost of exactly 4, it gets +50 HP.
You can play this card only if your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Stage 2 Pokémon.\n\nSearch your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You can play this card only if you discard a {D} Pokémon from your hand.\n\nDiscard a Pokémon Tool or Special Energy card from 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon, or discard any Stadium card in play.
Flip 2 coins. For each heads, shuffle an Electropower card from your discard pile into your deck.
You can play this card only if you have 4 or fewer other cards in your hand.\n\nDraw a card for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play.
You can play this card only if your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Stage 1 Pokémon.\n\nDraw 4 cards.
Prevent all damage done to the {Y} Pokémon this card is attached to by attacks from your opponent's Ultra Beast Pokémon-GX and Ultra Beast Pokémon-EX.
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a {G} Pokémon.

Look at the top card of your deck, and then choose 1:

• Discard your hand and draw 5 cards.
• Discard your hand and draw 5 cards from the bottom of your deck.
Search your deck for a {M} Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you go second and it's your first turn, search for 5 {M} Pokémon instead of 1. Then, shuffle your deck.

Choose 1:

• Draw a card.
• Put a Judge card from your discard pile into your hand.
Once during each player's turn, that player may have their opponent reveal their hand.

The {M} Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from your opponent’s attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance), and your opponent’s attacks and Abilities can't put damage counters on it.

You can play this card only if you discard Dana, Evelyn, and Nita from your hand.\n\nLook at the top 12 cards of your deck and attach any number of Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

Choose a Basic {D} Pokémon in your discard pile. Switch it with 1 of your Pokémon in play. Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.
You can play this card only if your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon.\n\nPut an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon on top of their deck.
Reveal a Pokémon from your hand and put it into your deck. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Put a card from your opponent’s discard pile on the bottom of their deck.
Your opponent reveals their hand. You may choose a Supporter card you find there and use the effect of that card as the effect of this card.
Play this card as if it were a 60-HP {C} Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.\n\nThis card can't retreat.

Once during each player’s turn, that player may discard a card from their hand. If they do, that player searches their deck for a basic Energy card, reveals it, and puts it into their hand. Then, that player shuffles their deck.
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a {W} Pokémon.

The attacks of non-{Y} Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) cost {C} more.\n\nWhenever any player plays an Item or Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Stadium card.

product.sm9.booster.6card.name: Sun & Moon—Team Up
product.sm9.pcd.relentlessflame.name: Relentless Flame
product.sm9.pcd.relentlessflame.sell-tex: Fire it up with the relentless flames of Charizard! This deck burns super hot, so keep feeding Charizard enough Fire Energy to create an unstoppable Continuous Blaze Ball. Burn bright and burn true with the Relentless Flame theme deck!
product.sm9.pcd.torrentialcannon.name: Torrential Cannon
product.sm9.pcd.torrentialcannon.sell-te: Give your opponent a high-pressure soaking with help from Blastoise! Use Golduck’s Amnesia to keep the other side off-balance as you power up a devastating Hydro Tackle attack. Wash away the competition with the Torrential Cannon theme deck!
product.sm9.pcd.torrentialcannon.tagline: Let It Rain, Let It Pour!
sleeves.sm9.etb.pikachuzekrom.name: Elite Trainer Pikachu & Zekrom Card Sleeves

specialvisualizations.sm9_110.keyofsecre: The Resistance of this player's {M} Pokémon is -40.
specialvisualizations.sm9_111.luminousba: This Pokémon is immune to all effects of attacks, including damage, done by opposing Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX.

specialvisualizations.sm9_61.paranormal: Damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Ultra Beasts is prevented.
